intro: Plexipus namaquanus, commonly known as the Namibian thornveld grass, is a perennial grass native to southern Africa. It typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. The plant has wiry, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes, which are often wind-pollinated. Its fibrous roots enable it to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in its natural habitat.
